articles.headline: Investors Are Calling It: The Federal Reserve May Be Done Raising Rates
articles.snippet: Investors doubt that central bankers will lift borrowing costs again following big market moves that are widely expected to cool growth.
articles.abstract: Investors doubt that central bankers will lift borrowing costs again following big market moves that are widely expected to cool growth.
articles.lead_paragraph: Investors are betting that the Federal Reserve, which has raised interest rates to their highest levels in 22 years, may finally be finished.
articles.byline: By Joe Rennison and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: Caroline Ellison Says She and Sam Bankman-Fried Lied for Years
articles.snippet: In her second day testifying at the FTX founder’s trial, Ms. Ellison said she had misled lenders and circulated phony financial documents at Mr. Bankman-Fried’s request.
articles.abstract: In her second day testifying at the FTX founder’s trial, Ms. Ellison said she had misled lenders and circulated phony financial documents at Mr. Bankman-Fried’s request.
articles.lead_paragraph: Caroline Ellison, a top adviser to the cryptocurrency mogul Sam Bankman-Fried, testified on Wednesday that she had lied over and over at his request, misleading the public about his businesses and circulating “dishonest” financial documents to crypto lenders.
articles.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany, Matthew Goldstein and J. Edward Moreno

articles.headline: Israel Forms Unity Government and Bombs Gaza in the Wake of Hamas Attack
articles.snippet: Following the deadliest assault on Israel in half a century, the country is vowing to crush Hamas, and both sides are bracing for an escalating war.
articles.abstract: Following the deadliest assault on Israel in half a century, the country is vowing to crush Hamas, and both sides are bracing for an escalating war.
articles.lead_paragraph: After the deadliest assault on Israel in 50 years, the right-wing government and members of the centrist opposition formed a unity government on Wednesday to navigate the crisis, while its warplanes rained destruction on the Gaza Strip and both sides braced for an escalating war between Israel and Hamas.
articles.byline: By Hiba Yazbek, Nicholas Casey and Patrick Kingsley

articles.headline: The Retired Israeli General Who Grabbed His Pistol and Took On Hamas
articles.snippet: By rushing to confront the attackers himself, Israel Ziv has become a public symbol of Israel’s former military successes — and its failure this time.
articles.abstract: By rushing to confront the attackers himself, Israel Ziv has become a public symbol of Israel’s former military successes — and its failure this time.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israel Ziv, a retired Israeli Army general, was taking a bike ride Saturday morning when a flood of alarming calls started coming in.

articles.headline: ‘A.I. Obama’ and Fake Newscasters: How A.I. Audio Is Swarming TikTok
articles.snippet: TikTok accounts are spreading falsehoods with help from A.I.-generated voices.
articles.abstract: TikTok accounts are spreading falsehoods with help from A.I.-generated voices.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a slickly produced TikTok video, former President Barack Obama — or a voice eerily like his — can be heard defending himself against an explosive new conspiracy theory about the sudden death of his former chef.
articles.byline: By Stuart A. Thompson and Sapna Maheshwari

articles.headline: Inflation Slowdown Remains Bumpy, September Consumer Price Data Shows
articles.snippet: Prices are rising at a pace that is much less rapid than in 2022, but signs of stalling progress are likely to keep Federal Reserve officials wary.
articles.abstract: Prices are rising at a pace that is much less rapid than in 2022, but signs of stalling progress are likely to keep Federal Reserve officials wary.
articles.lead_paragraph: Consumer prices grew at the same pace in September as they had in August, a report released on Thursday showed. The data contained evidence that the path toward fully wrangling inflation remains a long and bumpy one.

articles.headline: As Red States Curb Social Media, Did Montana’s TikTok Ban Go Too Far?
articles.snippet: Montana is at the forefront of a wave of new tech laws passed by Republican-led states. Some give parents control over their children’s social media accounts.
articles.abstract: Montana is at the forefront of a wave of new tech laws passed by Republican-led states. Some give parents control over their children’s social media accounts.
articles.lead_paragraph: Many of the world’s largest consumer technology companies will be closely monitoring a federal court hearing in Montana on Thursday that could decide whether TikTok will have to stop operating in the state next year.
articles.byline: By Natasha Singer, Sapna Maheshwari and David McCabe

articles.headline: Sam Bankman-Fried’s Closest Friends Become His Foes in Courtroom Clash
articles.snippet: The FTX founder’s criminal trial has made clear just how much his inner circle has turned against him.
articles.abstract: The FTX founder’s criminal trial has made clear just how much his inner circle has turned against him.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Sam Bankman-Fried’s cryptocurrency exchange collapsed in November, one of his oldest friends sent him a message of support.
articles.byline: By David Yaffe-Bellany and J. Edward Moreno

articles.headline: Scalise Withdraws as Speaker Candidate, Leaving G.O.P. in Chaos
articles.snippet: The No. 2 Republican had worked to win over holdouts but could not find a path to uniting his fractious party.
articles.abstract: The No. 2 Republican had worked to win over holdouts but could not find a path to uniting his fractious party.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our live updates for the House speaker vote.
articles.byline: By Luke Broadwater, Catie Edmondson and Karoun Demirjian
